relevant_findings.neurological: Glasgow Coma Scale score of 10; incomprehensible speech, intermittent moaning, did not follow commands; spontaneous movement of limbs, posturing movements.
relevant_findings.head: 2.5 cm by 2.5 cm hematoma on the forehead, facial abrasions on the right side; pupils round, equal, and sluggishly reactive.
relevant_findings.inguinal: Tender lymphadenopathy inferior to the left inguinal crease, a 2-mm punctate lesion superficial to one of the lymph nodes.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, the patient had visible posturing movements that resolved after diazepam was administered.

relevant_findings.neurological: Decreased responsiveness and persistent posturing movements.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: BP increased from initial 71/51 mm Hg to 125/84 mm Hg; respiratory rate improved from 22 to 16 breaths per minute.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI showed restricted diffusion involving multiple brain lobes and hyperintensity related to gyral swelling.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI showed improvement in cortical swelling and FLAIR hyperintensities.
